snippet: Two senior Obama administration officials said the mosquito-borne virus posed a more serious threat to the United States than experts initially believed.
abstract: Two senior Obama administration officials reaffirm additional funds are needed to combat Zika virus within United States, noting that threat is greater than believed; urge Congress to provide more resources.
lead_paragraph: Two senior Obama administration officials said the mosquito-borne virus posed a more serious threat to the United States than experts initially believed.

headline.main: Zika Fight Requires More Money, Congress Is Told
headline.print_headline: Congress Is Told U.S. Needs  More Money to Fight Zika

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
